title: Screwed out of my series due to client issues?
body: When I got to the third game in my promotional series, the client became an unresponsive black screen for the entire duration of champ select, only to reappear afterwards saying I left the queue. Waited out the penalty just to have the same thing happen again. After the half hour wait time, I finally get a functioning champ select screen. Go through a tight ass game and come out victorious just to realize that it didn't even count as my third series game, but  instead I have to work my way back up to it again now; after losing out on 20 LP, my series as a whole, and 35 minutes of my time due to client issues that Riot even acknowledged. I wasn't even aware that queue dodges would cost you your series. AFK'ing I understand, but dodging; especially when there's a technical issue like this involved, I don't understand why it even counts towards your series.

replies.body:
Leaving champion select during your series counts as a [queue dodge](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751844-Queue-Dodging) which is an automatic loss.  It sucks to hear that happened to you, and we do have a workaround for this issue.  Collapse your friends list groups before queuing for a match-

https://i.imgur.com/wMLOFya.png

It's also okay to use the legacy while the updated client is in testing as well.  Sorry again that happened to you, and while we can't change game stats I hope that can help give you a boost.  Good luck!
People take ranked seriously, please either fix the client/champ select function or make queue exit/dodge not count as a loss for promos.
